author: J.E.
title: Deion Sanders will get help from someone who worked with Tom Brady and was a Super Bowl champion | Marca
text:
I f you want to be the best, you have to surround yourself with the best, and it seems Colorado Buffaloes coach Deion Sanders understands that perfectly . Proof of this is his latest addition to his staff, a former NFL Super Bowl champion.
Who is Deion Sanders' new ally? It's former Tampa Bay Buccaneers offensive coordinator Byron Leftwich , who is reportedly joining "Coach Prime's" staff, according to NFL insider Jordan Schultz.
Colorado's future QB! Julian "Ju Ju" Lewis drops a dime and hits Shedeur Sanders' celebration While there's no official confirmation yet, it's likely that Leftwich will work closely with Colorado's offensive coordinator and quarterbacks coach, Pat Shurmur. Speculation also suggests he could take on a role as an offensive analyst or passing game coordinator.
Leftwich's Career After playing college football at Marshall, Leftwich was selected as the seventh overall pick in the 2003 NFL Draft by the Jacksonville Jaguars. He played four seasons with Jacksonville (2003-06) before spending time with the Pittsburgh Steelers (2008, 2010-12) and the Buccaneers (2009). Leftwich also served as the backup quarterback to the legendary Ben Roethlisberger when the Steelers won Super Bowl XLIII in 2009.
To the limit! Deion Sanders motivates one of his new Colorado quarterbacks by trying to defend him Why hasn't Deion Sanders taken an NFL coaching job?
Leftwich was spotted at Colorado's spring practice on Tuesday, though his hiring had yet to be officially reported.
The Arizona Cardinals gave Leftwich his first coaching opportunity in 2016 as a quarterback coaching intern. He was later promoted to quarterbacks coach in 2017 and served as interim offensive coordinator for part of the 2018 season.
In 2019, Leftwich reunited with head coach Bruce Arians as the offensive coordinator of the Tampa Bay Buccaneers. His reputation as a coach grew significantly in Tampa Bay, particularly working alongside quarterback Tom Brady, who spent the last three years of his NFL career under Leftwich's offensive leadership. Together, Leftwich, Brady, and the Buccaneers won Super Bowl LV in 2021.

author: AFP
title: Allemagne: les salariés de Volkswagen en grève à partir de lundi - Challenges
text:
Le conflit social est désormais inéluctable pour le premier constructeur européen: tous les salariés de Volkswagen en Allemagne sont appelés à cesser le travail à partir de lundi pour s'opposer aux milliers de suppressions d'emplois envisagées.
C'est la première étape d'un mouvement qui pourrait prendre une ampleur inédite si la direction et les représentants du personnels ne parviennent pas à trouver d'accord sur les mesures d'économies pour restructurer le groupe en crise.
Une perspective qui survient en pleine campagne pour les élections législatives anticipées en Allemagne.
"Des grèves d'avertissement commenceront lundi dans toutes les usines", a annoncé dimanche dans un communiqué Thorsten Gröger, le négociateur du syndicat IG Metall, à l'issue de la période de dialogue social obligatoire pour 120.000 employés de la marque en Allemagne.
"Si nécessaire, ce sera la bataille de négociation collective la plus dure que Volkswagen ait jamais connue", prévient-il, tenant la direction pour "responsable, à la table des négociations, de la durée et de l'intensité de cet affrontement".
Dans un communiqué séparé, Volkswagen a dit "respecter le droit des salariés" et croire au "dialogue constructif", en vertu du principe de cogestion, pour "parvenir à une solution durable et soutenue collectivement".
L'entreprise précise avoir "anticipé des mesures ciblées pour sécuriser l'approvisionnement d'urgence" pendant le mouvement.
Dans le pays, Volkswagen compte dix sites de production de voitures et environ 300.000 salariés, dont 120.000 pour la marque VW, la plus concernée par le plan d'économies.
IG Metall, le puissant syndicat de la métallurgie a dit être prêt "à un conflit social comme la République fédérale n'en a pas connu depuis des décennies".
Le premier constructeur européen a lancé en septembre une chasse aux coûts inédite, visant des économies de plusieurs milliards d'euros pour redresser sa compétitivité.
Trois séances de négociations entre direction et syndicat ont eu lieu et "la différence entre les positions est encore énorme", selon Thorsten Gröger.
Le fossé s'est même creusé avec le rejet vendredi par la direction d'une contre-proposition syndicale visant à réduire les coûts sans avoir à fermer d'usines en Allemagne.
- Première historique -
La direction du groupe continue d'envisager de fermer des usines en Allemagne, trois selon le syndicat, ce qui serait une première dans l'histoire du groupe.
Les deux parties se retrouveront le 9 décembre à Wolfsburg pour un quatrième tour des négociations.
Fleuron de l'industrie automobile allemande, Volkswagen souffre à la fois du ralentissement du marché des véhicules neufs, de la concurrence chinoise, de modèles à batterie pas assez attractifs, et de coûts de main d’œuvre plus élevés que ses rivaux, selon les experts.
La crise chez Volkswagen reflète les difficultés de l'industrie allemande, confrontée ces derniers mois à une kyrielle de plans sociaux dans les secteurs de l'automobile, la chimie, la sidérurgie, alors que l'activité économique du pays devrait se contracter en 2024, pour la deuxième année de suite.
- Thème de campagne -
La paralysie politique obscurcit aussi l'horizon depuis la rupture début novembre de la coalition du chancelier Olaf Scholz, qui provoque l'organisation d'élections anticipées le 23 février.
La relance de l'économie s'est imposée comme un enjeu central de la campagne.
Ainsi samedi, le chancelier social-démocrate (SPD) Olaf Scholz et le chef de file des conservateurs (CDU) Friedrich Merz se sont opposés sur le sujet par meetings interposés.
Favori des sondages, Friedrich Merz a fustigé "l'interventionnisme teinté de vert dans chaque domaine de la vie, chaque entreprise, chaque secteur d'activité" des Verts et du SPD, alliés au sein de la coalition gouvernementale.
Olaf Scholz, pour qui la CDU a "toujours la même recette", faite de baisses d'impôts pour les entreprises, a lui proposé de rembourser 10% d'impôts sur les sommes investies par les entreprises dans le pays.

author: The Hindu Bureau
title: Heavy downpour throws normal life out of gear - The Hindu
text:
Water stagnating at Goripalayam junction in Madurai on Friday. | Photo Credit: MOORTHY G
Heavy downpour in most places in Southern districts on Friday brought normal life to a standstill.
Even though the Indian Meteorological Department had alerted about the rainfall, the day-long rain was overwhelming, especially for those whose jobs compelled them to venture out.
In Madurai, some of the areas like K.K. Nagar on Madurai – Melur main Road, North Bank Road, Goripalayam Road, among others, were inundated with rainwater.
Outskirts like Melur, Usilampatti, Vadipatti also witnessed moderate to heavy rainfall.
Similarly, Ramanathapuram district recorded 64.60mm rainfall on Friday. The heavy rainfall for the last few days, had disrupted the routine of the fishermen and traders associated with the fishing industry.
Some areas like Venkateshwara Colony, Bharathi Nagar, subway on the Paramakudi to Mudukulathur route, among other areas were heavily inundated.
In areas like Thirupuvanam and Ilayankudi in Sivaganga district, about 400 acres of chilly and paddy fields were under water.
Particularly in pockets of Palayanur, Alagudaiyan, Achankulam, Aanaikulam, Sangankulam, Salai village, North Salai village, Samuthiram, Sathanur, Viraiyathakandan, Gabrielpatnam, chilly fields were inundated with rainwater, sources said.
As it was the time of harvest, the damage would be irrevocable, so the State government should take note of the damage and provide farmers with compensation, farmers demanded.
Published - December 13, 2024 10:04 pm IST

author: ABC.es
title: «Alinghi» no levanta cabeza y ha perdido los dos enfrentamientos que ha disputado
text: Copa América «Alinghi» no levanta cabeza y ha perdido los dos enfrentamientos que ha disputado Louis Vuitton Cup Poco viento en el campo de regatas de Barcelona que acortó la jornada Un día complicado para los oficiales de regata de la Louis Vuitton Cup, que lograron completar dos mangas antes de que el viento bajara por debajo del límite inferior promedio de 6,5 nudos en un recorrido cargado de viento y provocara que la carrera se cancelara a regañadientes antes del inicio entre los equipos italiano y estadounidense. La madre naturaleza tuvo mucho que decir en la primera regata completada del día, ya que el Alinghi Red Bull Racing se cayó de sus foils casi inmediatamente en el cajón de pre-salida después de una primera trasluchada lenta en medio de una importante corriente de aire detrás del 'Patriot' del NYYC American Magic que cruzaba. Al ser casi imposible ganar velocidad suficiente para poder volar con los foils, los suizos se vieron frustrados por el desplazamiento, pero mantuvieron una calma resuelta a bordo. Al principio, los estadounidenses no encontraron oposición, navegaron con los foils y lograron una enorme ventaja que mantuvieron tenazmente gracias al excelente control del barco por parte de los timoneles Tom Slingsby y Paul Goodison, junto con un control de vuelo aún mejor por parte de Michael Menninger y Andrew Campbell. Sin embargo, fue una regata que nunca pareció terminada y que estuvo en peligro en las cuatro etapas del recorrido. El Comité de Regatas acortó repetidamente la longitud del recorrido y finalmente decidió que la meta se llevara a cabo al final del cuarto tramo (de seis posibles) con el límite de tiempo de 45 minutos como factor, por lo que los barcos llegaron a desplazarse, sin sus foils sincronizados, desesperados por lograr el vuelo. Ambos equipos navegaron en ángulos altos de borde a borde en busca de ráfagas de brisa de tierra de Barcelona y, aunque ambos lograron volver al aire, fue un viaje breve y precario. Sin embargo, los americanos habían logrado una enorme ventaja de casi una eslora y cruzaron la línea de meta como un fantasma, nuevamente sin usar los foils, para lograr su primera victoria en la Louis Vuitton Cup. Alinghi Red Bull Racing cogió un nuevo viento en la parte superior del recorrido y lo mantuvo hasta el final del tramo final, volando alto, navegando brillantemente pero con una diferencia de dos minutos y 58 segundos. Después de la carrera, Tom Slingsby se mostró optimista pero realista sobre las condiciones y dijo: «Teníamos un poco de viento cuando comenzamos la carrera y los habíamos sacado de los foils, así que pensamos 'bueno, deberíamos poder navegar por la pista'. Pero el viento comenzó a disminuir y pasó de 7,5 a 6,5 nudos y luego tuvimos tramos de cinco nudos a veces. Cuando nos salimos de los foils en la última manga, comencé a intentar hacer cálculos mentales: si navego a 10 nudos a 120 grados y él ahora está en los foils, ¿cuánto tiempo le llevará alcanzarnos? Esas condiciones son muy estresantes y me alegro de que tuviéramos una ventaja lo suficientemente grande como para sumar puntos. Es realmente difícil en estas condiciones sentir que estás ganando impulso. A pesar de que obtuvimos la victoria hoy, siempre estás al borde, donde un pequeño error y te sales de los foils y la carrera se acaba». En cuanto a la regata que se perdió con Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli, Tom añadió: «Luna Rossa, son una tarea más difícil. Con todo el respeto a Alinghi Red Bull Racing, los italianos parecen ser los que más luchan y serán muy difíciles de vencer, especialmente en esas condiciones». Para los suizos, la competición está siendo dura después de la derrota en la primera jornada ante el Orient Express Racing Team y de nuevo hoy, pero Arnaud Psarofaghis, patrón del Alinghi Red Bull Racing, se mostró positivo y dijo después: «Hoy ha sido un día complicado, entre el límite de viento y una regata justa en el campo de regatas, pero nos gustan las regatas complicadas. Si nos hubiera ido bien, habría sido un poco mejor, pero ha sido interesante. Hemos cometido un error en la entrada, American Magic hizo un buen trabajo para frenarnos y la regata no terminó ahí porque sabíamos que podía pasar algo y simplemente intentamos luchar para recuperarnos. Desafortunadamente, tuvimos una brisa muy ligera en la parte inferior del campo de regatas y luego simplemente intentamos volver a ponernos en el foil. Son sólo dos regatas, dos derrotas. Creo que todo el mundo puede hacer algo extraño un día y para nosotros ha sido hoy». En la segunda regata del día, el INEOS Britannia compitió sin rivales contra el Emirates Team New Zealand, que no navegaba. El programa y las reglas dictaban que el equipo británico de Sir Ben Ainslie debía completar la secuencia de salida y comenzar la regata antes de que el árbitro principal, Richard Slater, anunciara la victoria de los británicos. Dylan Fletcher, timonel del lado de babor del INEOS Britannia, llegó a tierra con la esperanza de que el tiempo mejorara el sábado y de que se disputaran dos regatas contra Alinghi Red Bull Racing y Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli. Cuando le preguntaron cómo se estaba preparando el equipo para esas dos regatas, Dylan comentó: «Creo que estamos aprovechando la experiencia de la Louis Vuitton Preliminary Regatta, donde quizás tuvimos un poco de suerte de nuestro lado en la salida contra American Magic, pero nos hemos estado preparando mucho en la SIM con nuestro entrenador titular Ian Williams, así que estamos deseando que llegue la pelea».

author: BobBrown Community Member
title: Re: Trouble Connecting Nest Hub
text:
Sunday
I purchased a new Nest Hub and I am finding it impossible to connect to my Google Nest Pro WiFi network. I first repeatedly got an error message indicating “failure to connect”. I then moved the hub closer to the primary web point, when I plugged the unit in, it updated the software twice and then indicated that I needed to “Link account” in Google Home. When I open Google Home, my account appears to be linked, but the error message will not go away and I still can’t connect it to my WiFi network, which by the way is Google Nest Pro. This is a very frustrating experience and I am on the verge of returning the product to the store. Any suggestions would be helpful.
2 hours ago
Hi Bobbrown,
Thank you for your response. I'm sorry to hear that you're unable to set up your Nest Hub for the error message “failure to connect”. I'm happy to help you!
At the moment, i need to ask a few questions to give the correct troubleshooting below:
keep me posted.
Best regards,
Rusell.
2 hours ago
Hello Russell:
Thank you for your response. There are no other Google Nest displays in my home, and this is a house (not a business, school or a shared apartment network). I am able to find my network (which is a Google Nest Pro Web wifi network). I have followed all of the suggestions mentioned on this forum, with no success. When I have attempted to connect, I have placed the device on my office desk, near the primary Google Nest Pro Web node and away from TVs and audio speakers.
If you need any additional information or have other suggestions, please let me know.
Bob
a minute ago
This afternoon, I noticed that the Google Home app needed to be updated on my iPhone. So I completed the update and attempted to connect the Nest Hub again:
This all very frustrating and I have no clue as to what is going or why.
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: The Roar
title: ‘Disappointed a lot of people’: Gustavsson apologises after Matildas rocked by 2016 champs in brutal Olympic reality check
text:
The Matildas’ Olympic campaign is off to the worst possible start, crushed 3-0 by a rampant Germany in Marseille in a bitter reality check for Tony Gustavsson’s team.
Having dominated lesser opposition earlier in the year to cruise into qualification for the Paris Games, Australia must now regroup and fast before their second group stage match against Zambia in Nice on Monday morning (AEST).
Olympic Games Paris 2024. Every Event. Ad-free. Live & On Demand. 4K. 8 Exclusive International channels from Eurosport, Viacom18 and Sky NZ, only on Stan Sport .
Set pieces were a continuous thorn in the Matildas’ side, with the world’s fourth-ranked side and 2016 Olympic champions scoring twice from headed corners before a second half tap-in from Julie Brand put the exclamation mark on the rout.
Making matters worse, the scoreline arguably flattered them, with Germany missing several gilt-edged chances that could have made things even uglier.
Speaking after the loss, Gustavsson could only apologise to fans for the performance, lamenting the Tillies’ ‘rusty performance’.
“I just want to say I’m so sorry to let down the fans back home… I know we disappointed a lot of people,” he said.
“This side is so physical normally, we win all the one-on-one duels, there’s aggressiveness there, we’re running and our speed beats teams. But it wasn’t really there tonight.
“Hopefully that was the rusty performance we hopefully needed to get out of the system and then come back against Zambia.”
The Matildas were left to rue a crippling lack of match fitness, with the absence of champion striker Sam Kerr due to injury also leaving a gaping hole.
The loss continues a wretched start to the Paris Games in which everything that could go wrong has gone wrong, with the team notably having had their bags briefly go missing in transit upon arrival in France.
FULL TIME | Our opening game of #Paris2024 ends in defeat. All eyes on Zambia ???? #Matildas #TilitsDone #AllezAUS #Olympics pic.twitter.com/wm8MlAnPGW
— Matildas (@TheMatildas) July 25, 2024 Gustavsson is hopeful the Matildas can repeat their famous recovery from a similar sluggish start to their 2023 Women’s World Cup campaign on home soil, where the team rebounded from a shock group stage loss to Nigeria to make it all the way to the semi-finals.
“I think we needed that as a wake-up call to say okay, now we’re in it,” he said.
“The one thing I know about this team is that when they’re backed against a corner and there’s a lot of s–t thrown at them with curve balls and different ways, a loss 3-0 or baggage going missing… they never use these things as excuses.”
Speaking after the match, captain Steph Catley echoed Gustavvson’s sentiments, saying the defeat was a ‘wake-up call’.
“We did it to ourselves in the end – we conceded two set pieces. We are usually much, much better on set pieces,” she said.
More Olympics Paris Olympics swimming preview: Which mornings should you wake up early? In a totally changed Olympic media landscape, thank God for Bruce McAvaney The hard work is done for the Aussie Sevens women - now it's time to make their Olympic dream come true 'To target the Games is to target France': Arson attacks leave Paris in chaos hours from Olympic opening ceremony 'Smash the bastards': How an iconic Bob Hawke quip inspired Aussie sevens to USA annihilation in Olympic quarter-final Olympics “It’s a wake-up call, and it’s not to our standard – we know that, so we’ll go back and look at what we need to improve, and we need to be better for the next game and turn this tournament around.”
When asked by a Nine reporter how they could achieve this, Catley tersely replied ‘what I just said’.
The reaction to the loss has been swift and brutal, with the Matildas coming in for a barrage of criticism – none harsher than from former Socceroo Robbie Slater, who says the team may have ‘gotten ahead of themselves’ after a bumper 2023 where they became clearly Australia’s most popular sports team thanks to their home World Cup heroics.
“Here’s an idea - how about the Matildas concentrate on playing football and forget about the off-field hype,” Slater wrote in The Australian .
“If they don’t, their dream of securing an Olympic Games medal will become a nightmare.
“While it’s all well and good talking about ‘legacy’ and ‘brand’, the best way to build ‘legacy’ and ‘brand’ is by winning… unless they improve their attitude, they might as well pack their bags and go home now.”
Slater also criticised Football Australia for their handling of the Matildas, accusing them of concentrating more on the team’s appeal to the nation rather than their results.
“For FA chief executive officer James Johnson to say that regardless of the Matildas’ performance at the Olympics, ‘they’re defined by the legacy that they’ve already created’ was alarming,” Slater wrote.
The Matildas look dejected after their Olympic loss to Germany. (Photo by Alex Livesey/Getty Images)
“It’s no wonder the team seems to have a complacent attitude when Johnson suggests it doesn’t matter how the team performs at the Paris Games.
“Johnson has made no secret of taking full advantage of the Matildas brand so FA can make as much money as possible from the team’s current popularity.
“However, what FA needs to realise is that while it’s all well and good talking about ‘legacy’ and ‘brand’, the best way to build ‘legacy’ and ‘brand’ is by winning.”
Slater has a history of criticising the Matildas, notably being widely panned for a 2023 article claiming Sam Kerr shouldn’t be celebrated for breaking Tim Cahill’s record for most goals scored by an Australian, male or female.
An even harsher critic was always controversial former Wallaby Greg Martin, who accused the Matildas of ‘believing their own hype’ in a staggering rant on Triple M Brisbane .
“Quite simply, the Matildas have become the Brisbane Broncos. Their heads are so far up their bums they have believed in their own hype,” Martin said.
“Every single photo I’ve got is of them drinking a cocktail on either a beach or a nightclub in the last six months… they haven’t been doing the hard work.
“The harder you work, the luckier you get and right at the moment it appears that the Tillies don’t appear to be working very hard.”
Eight teams of the 12 who qualified for the Games will make it through to the knockout stage, meaning the Matildas’ hopes of progressing are far from done – but they’ll need to improve fast.
A win over Zambia in their next match, who are ranked 64th in the world, should be enough to avoid bottom spot in the group and a humiliating first-stage exit; however, waiting in the wings is the mighty USA in their final group stage match, with another performance similar to that against Germany potentially enough to leave them as the third-ranked third-placed team, which would eliminate them from the tournament.
